intro: Malapoenna pallens, commonly known as the white-flowered malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth texture. Malapoenna pallens is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
